body.name: Storkcraft Hillcrest 4-in-1 Convertible Crib (Natural) - Converts to Daybed, Toddler Bed, and Full-Size Bed, Fits Standard Full-Size Crib Mattress, Adjustable Mattress Support Base
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 8 hrs 25 mins
features: 4-IN-1 CONVERTIBLE CRIB: Converts from crib (mattress sold separately) to toddler bed (compatible with 1 or 2 toddler guardrails, each sold separately), daybed, and full-size bed (compatible full-size bed conversion kit sold separately; Assembly required

ADAPTS TO YOUR GROWING BABY: Equipped with an adjustable mattress support base with 4 different height options; Designed to fit any standard full-size crib & toddler mattress (mattress sold separately); Backed by a 1-year limited manufacturer’s warranty

JPMA CERTIFIED, SAFETY TESTED: Expert tested by third-party, accredited laboratories to meet or exceed all applicable category voluntary and mandatory safety standards; Applied finish tested to meet or exceed applicable ASTM and CPSIA safety standards
QUALITY CRAFTSMANSHIP: Crafted with pine wood, engineered wood, and wood composites; Packaging tested to reduce the risk of incidental damage that could occur during shipment

AWARD-WINNING BRAND: Storkcraft is the proud recipient of the Parent Tested Parent Approved (PTPA) Seal of Approval for nursery and children’s furniture, and the Women’s Choice Award for 9 out of 10 Recommended Baby & Kids Furniture from 2018-2023
body.description: Bring your dream nursery to life with the Storkcraft Hillcrest 4-in-1 Convertible Crib. With its timeless, versatile design and classic details, the Hillcrest is the perfect addition to any nursery – no matter your style. The Hillcrest is crafted from pine wood and engineered wood, and its applied finish has been tested to meet or exceed the applicable ASTM and CPSIA safety standards. The Hillcrest is JPMA Certified — meaning it’s been expert tested by third-party, accredited laboratories to meet or exceed all of the applicable category voluntary and mandatory safety standards. Designed to adapt to your growing baby, the Hillcrest is equipped with an adjustable mattress support base with 4 different height options so the mattress support base’s position can be lowered as your child grows (please note, this crib may only be used until your child can easily climb out or is taller than 35 inches (89 cm). To support your child’s journey from babyhood to toddlerhood (and beyond), the Hillcrest is able to be converted from a baby crib to a toddler bed [compatible with 1 or 2 toddler safety guardrails, each sold separately. Look for Graco Universal Toddler Safety Guardrail (Slats) – Model Number 01350-30x Series], daybed, and full-size bed with headboard only [compatible with full-size bed conversion kit, sold separately. Look for Graco Full-Size Bed Conversion Kit – Model Number 10001-200]. The Storkcraft Hillcrest 4-in-1 Convertible Crib is designed to accommodate any standard full-size crib & toddler mattress (mattress sold separately). Storkcraft is the proud recipient of the Parent Tested Parent Approved (PTPA) Seal of Approval for nursery and children’s bedroom furniture, and the Women's Choice Award for 9 out of 10 Recommended Baby & Kids Furniture from 2018-2023. Backed by a 1-year limited manufacturer’s warranty. Assembly required. Mattress, toddler safety guardrails, and full-size bed conversion kit each sold separately. Assembled dimensions: H (34.00 inches) x L (30.71 inches) x W (54.73 inches).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Simple set up and it looks great! Very sturdy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent crib for the price.
reviews.reviewText: A very good crib.1. How does it look - It looks really good. We bought the one in white and it looks good. No complaints.2. Build quality - They are well built. The paint quality is also good. After assembling, the crib is not too heavy and you can move it from one room to another with little effort.3. How easy are they to assemble - On a scale of 1-10 (1 being “why did I buy this” and 10 being extremely easy) I would give them a solid 7. They are not difficult to assemble. The package will have some 15 odd parts with all the screws you’d need and the time it took me to assemble this from scratch was 50 mins. The instructions are straight forward, diagrams are easy to understand and everything just fits well.4. Any negatives - While assembling, be a little careful as to not drop anything sharp (like screws) on any of the parts. If that happens, it will create a small dent.Will definitely recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very solid and sturdy
reviews.reviewText: This crib is very high quality despite it being on the cheaper end of crib pricing. It did not take my husband long to put together and the finished product was a solid, sturdy and beautiful crib. We bought the natural finish and it’s just beautiful. The company sent a very thoughtful personal message attached to the directions and product information that you just don’t see with other cribs on the market. We are very pleased with this purchase and look forward to our baby enjoying this all the way up to toddlerhood.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price
reviews.reviewText: We wanted something simple. I am 5’1 and the height feels perfect , even when it’s time to start lowering the mattress.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and easy to assemble

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Crib and a Great Deal!!
reviews.reviewText: I really love this crib! I needed a second crib for my bedroom that didn’t take up much space and I have to say that I surprisingly prefer this one over the $1200 crib I have in the nursery! I love that it’s small and has a low profile which makes easy to reach my child way down at the bottom notch and also very easy to move from place to place around the room. It’s not quite as sturdy as my other crib (perhaps that’s because it’s so much lighter than my other one) but it’s still plenty sturdy enough for my 20 month old and I expect to get many more years of wear out of with more babies. I love how to has a clean design which goes with any decor. It’s a really great crib and I can see myself getting lots of use out of it. I honestly wish someone would have advised me to purchase something like this prior to me purchasing my first and (over priced) crib. This one is great and you can’t beat the price for the quality! I was definitely impressed! Hubby put it together in about 90 minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Worth every penny, fits easily in the space I need and it’s easy to assemble as to I’ve got one for my other kiddo just like it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great crib for short parent(s)
reviews.reviewText: Disclaimer: I've only had the bed for a week. That being said, this crib is perfect for those of us out there that are vertically challenged (short) This crib sits much closer to the floor than any crib I've had. If you're looking to store stuff under the crib, this one won't work for you. There is probably only a 6-12" clearance at the bottom. In other cribs, when I had the mattress set to the lowest position, I could not reach my child if they were laying down. May not sound like a big deal, but when they puke in the middle of the night and are still half asleep, they aren't real good at taking orders to stand up. I'd have to wake my husband to come grab them up for me. Most crib heights would to right below my breasts. I'm 5'1". This bed is only waist high. It's so nice to have my child easily accesible to me. It also isn't as dominating in the room, making the space look bigger. We bought the gray colored crib and it really looks nice. Doesn't look cheap at all. The crib is very solid. I put it together by myself and it took a hour. I probably could have been quicker, but I was assembling it in a tight space which isn't easy at 33 weeks pregnant. I'm very happy with this purchase and see no reason why it won't last till I'm done needing a crib.

Great price (great value!) and arrived very quickly! Very easily assembled - took my husband and I 45 minutes max! The crib is a great blend of modern and traditional, so it's very versatile. Nothing arrived broken or damaged and the overall construction of the crib is excellent. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: ... for another few months but building it was extremely easy and its very sturdy
reviews.reviewText: Haven't been able to use it yet since we aren't due for another few months but building it was extremely easy and its very sturdy. I would recommend measuring your door frame into the room you are going to putting the crib. We built ours in the living room and then had to take it back a part in order to get it into the baby room.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not very practical due to low levels only
reviews.reviewText: Nice crib but not too practical. There are 3 levels but very low. Bending over to pick the baby up is not easy right after giving birth. Back pain guaranteed with this one. 2 stars and I'm being generous

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the look of this crib
reviews.reviewText: Love the look of this crib. It was pretty easy to put together. However after assembling the crib I noticed a piece of the crib was broken. the wood was broken where one side of the cribs fits into the other. Did not return it because it would have been too much hassle to take apart and return.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality cribs at a great price!
reviews.reviewText: Bought a pair of these cribs for our soon to be born twin boys. Showed up on time with mild damage to one of the boxes but the cribs are well packed in styrofoam and foam wrap so no issues with any damages. Struggled for over an hour putting the first one together as the diagrams in the manual weren't the greatest, but put the second one together in 26 minutes so I guess practice does make perfect. Cribs are only 34"high which makes for easy access for my wife who is 5' 3". There is a bit of an odour to the cribs so it's a good idea to get them built early and let them air out a bit. Overall they are very simple and understated but solidly built and a great price.
